meanings.definition: A complete, catalytically active enzyme consisting of an apoenzyme and a cofactor.
meanings.sent1: The holoenzymes in our body help speed up chemical reactions.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study holoenzymes to understand how enzymes work in living organisms.
meanings.sent3: The holoenzymes at the party were the life of the biochemical reaction!
meanings.sent4: Her passion for science was like a holoenzyme, catalyzing change wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The holoenzymes danced together, creating a symphony of biological processes.

meanings.definition: Enzymes that consist of a protein component (apoenzyme) and a non-protein component (cofactor).
meanings.sent1: The holoenzymes in the lab were carefully mixed to observe their reactions.
meanings.sent2: In biochemistry, researchers often analyze holoenzymes to uncover their functions.
meanings.sent3: The chef treated the holoenzymes in the recipe like a secret ingredient.
meanings.sent4: The relationship between the two countries was a delicate balance, much like holoenzymes.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the holoenzymes appeared like tiny machines working together.
